All Classes and Interfaces

Classes
Class
Description
Button
The Button class acts as the manager of all the buttons that appear on the screen.
Die
Represents a die object, but there's not much code here as all die-rolling logic is handled by GameBoard (The Die class code is still "necessary" so that we can instantiate a Die object and have a graphical "sprite" that you can click on with your mouse when prompted to do so)
GameBoard
This is the physical board for my Wormhole Dash game.
GameManager
Write a description of class GameManager here.
Overlay
Overlay acts as a filter over the gameboard when shifting focus to a button that displays something.
PlayerPiece
Represents a player's game piece -- player 1's pieces (for player index 0) are red spaceships, player 2's pieces (for player index 1) are blue spaceships.
Space
Represents a GameBoard space and its associated attributes (i.e., is it a reroll space or not, is it occupied by a given player's piece or not, etc.)
TitleScreen
Title screen that appears when the game first starts.
Wormhole
Does nothing, just an aesthetic goal zone in theme with the name of the game.
